incidents.name: [INCIDENT] AI Actions & Workflow Automations not executing

incident_updates.body: The incident has been resolved.
The incident has been resolved. There may still be some slower processing than usual while the upstream provider is fully recovering.
Our monitoring systems have detected an outage of a upstream provider orchestrating jobs that are responsible for executing AI Actions and Workflow Automations. We expect to see delayed execution.

incidents.name: Webhooks are Delayed for Some Customers

incident_updates.body:
The issue causing webhook delivery delays for some customers has been fully resolved. Webhook processing is now functioning normally, and no further delays are expected. We will continue to monitor the system to ensure stability.
Thank you for your patience while we worked to address the issue.

Webhook delivery is currently delayed for a subset of customers. We are actively investigating the issue, and we will provide updates as more information becomes available. We apologize for any inconvenience and appreciate your patience.

incidents.name: Errors with Contentful Funtions

incident_updates.body: This issue has now been resolved.
We are seeing recovery of services and errors have subsided. We will continue to monitor the situation.
Customers are still experiencing errors with Contentful Functions. We continue to work with our external provider on the issue.

We are currently experiencing issues affecting Contentful Functions, which are intermittently failing to create and execute as expected. This disruption is due to a problem with one of our providers.
Our team is actively monitoring the situation and working with the provider to resolve the issue as quickly as possible.

incidents.name: Issues with SSO Login

incident_updates.body: We have confirmed that the fix we deployed has resolved the issue.
We have put a mitigation in place for this issue, and users should now be able to log in via SSO again.
Some customers are experiencing issues logging in to Contentful via SSO. We have identified the cause and are working to mitigate the issue.

incidents.name: Degraded Web App Asset Uploader

incident_updates.body: This issue is now resolved
This issue is now resolved, we will keep monitoring the situation before fully closing the incident. Customers should refresh their web app page to see the standard asset uploader again.

We are experiencing degraded performance on our Web App asset uploader. We have enabled a simpler fallback uploader that provides less functionality while we investigate the issue. Customers will need to reload the webapp to use the fallback uploader.

incidents.name: Connectivity issues to Content Delivery APIs (CDA and GraphQL)

incident_updates.body: The error rates are back to normal.
Error rates have dropped to normal levels and network connectivity issues have been resolved. We will continue to monitor the situation for the next few hours.
We are working with our services providers, and are now seeing a drop in error rates and a return to normal. We are monitoring the situation.

We are continuing to investigate what we believe to be network connectivity issues. The impact is limited to a small proportion of our total traffic. We will provide an update as soon as we have more information.
Some customers are experiencing increased errors or timeouts on the Content Delivery API and GraphQL API. We are currently investigating the issue.

incidents.name: "Duplicate key" errors when attempting to update Content

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We have deployed a fix for this issue and are monitoring the results. Customer should no longer be experiencing these types of "duplicate key" errors.

We have identified an issue which was introduced in the past week where a small subset of customer requests are receiving the following error: 
"duplicate key value violates unique constraint "draft_entries_fts_space_id_entry_id_locale_unique": duplicate key value violates unique constraint "draft_entries_fts_space_id_entry_id_locale_unique". 
We have narrowed down the root cause and are working on a fix for the issue.

incidents.name: Issues with Personalization Management API

incident_updates.body: The issue has been resolved.
We have resolved the issue and are monitoring the situation.
The Personalization Management API is reporting "Bad Gateway" to all requests. We are investigating the issue.

incidents.name: Issues with GraphQL Schema registry

incident_updates.body: This issue has been resolved.
We have identified the cause of the issue and implemented a fix. Customers are able to successfully get up to date schemas from Contentful's GraphAPI. We are continuing to monitor the situation.
We are investigating an issue with GraphQL schema registry. Some customers may not be able to get up to date schemas for Contentful GraphAPI

We are investigating an issue where customers are not receiving emails from Contentful (e.g new user invites, customer password resets).

incidents.name: Transactional emails not being sent for Tasks, Comments and Workflows

incident_updates.body: All transactional emails are being sent out again for changes to workflows, tasks and comments.

We have an ongoing partial outage on transactional emails. Customers are no longer receiving email notifications as a result of changes to workflows, tasks or comments. Customers will need to go into the Contentful WebApp to review the state of tasks, comments or workflows as a result. We apologise for any inconvenience this may cause.

incidents.name: Transactional Emails outage

incident_updates.body: Transactional emails are fully operational again.
Transactional emails are not being processed by our email provider. Password reset emails, invites, task mentions and similar notifications are impacted.

incidents.name: Missing fields from Content APIs

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The cache purge was completed and we confirmed the recovery of the missing fields. We will continue to monitor the recovery for the next few minutes.
We have deployed a fix for the issue. We are in the process of purging all the cache for malformed responses, which should be the last step of the mitigation.
We discovered an issue in our Content APIs that resulted in some fields being omitted in the API response. We have identified the causing issue and are working on a change.

incidents.name: Delays in Content type changes being reflected in GraphQL API

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

A fix has been deployed which has resolved the issue. We are running a job to pick up all content type changes which were made but not reflected in GraphQL API in the past hour. This will be completed in the next 30 mins. (Customer affected can also republish their content types again if they don't wish to wait).
Some customers may be experiencing delays in changes to their content types being reflected in the GraphQL Content API. We have identified the cause and are working on mitigating the issue

incidents.name: Errors uploading files on Contentful WebApp

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

While our mitigation has resolved the issue of customers receiving errors when uploading assets, the following functionality is not currently available. 
- Rotate/Resize/Crop Images in the Contentful WebApp
- Upload of images from third parties
We continue to work on this issue.
Customers who are still experiencing errors uploading files to Contentful WebApp should refresh the page and retry the upload.
